intro: Ternstroemia occidentalis, commonly known as the western ternstroemia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Theaceae, which includes camellias and other ornamental shrubs. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland areas. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for ecological studies and horticultural use.
